   20: -module(compile_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: %% Tests compile:file/1 and compile:file/2 with various options.
   23: 
   24: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   25: -include_lib("stdlib/include/erl_compile.hrl").
   26: 
   27: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   28: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   29: 	 app_test/1,appup_test/1,bigE_roundtrip/1,
   30: 	 debug_info/4, custom_debug_info/1, custom_compile_info/1,
   31: 	 file_1/1, forms_2/1, module_mismatch/1, outdir/1,
   32: 	 binary/1, makedep/1, cond_and_ifdef/1, listings/1, listings_big/1,
   33: 	 other_output/1, kernel_listing/1, encrypted_abstr/1,
   34: 	 strict_record/1, utf8_atoms/1, utf8_functions/1, extra_chunks/1,
   35: 	 cover/1, env/1, core_pp/1, tuple_calls/1,
   36: 	 core_roundtrip/1, asm/1, asm_labels/1,
   37: 	 sys_pre_attributes/1, dialyzer/1, no_core_prepare/1,
   38: 	 warnings/1, pre_load_check/1, env_compiler_options/1,
   39:          bc_options/1, deterministic_include/1, deterministic_paths/1,
   40:          compile_attribute/1, message_printing/1, other_options/1,
   41:          transforms/1, erl_compile_api/1, types_pp/1, bs_init_writable/1,
   42:          annotations_pp/1
   43: 	]).
   44: 
   45: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   46: 
   47: %% To cover the stripping of 'type' and 'spec' in beam_asm.
   48: -type all_return_type() :: [atom()].
   49: -spec all() -> all_return_type().
   50: 
   51: all() -> 
   52:     [app_test, appup_test, bigE_roundtrip, file_1,
   53:      forms_2, module_mismatch, outdir,
   54:      binary, makedep, cond_and_ifdef, listings, listings_big,
   55:      other_output, kernel_listing, encrypted_abstr, tuple_calls,
   56:      strict_record, utf8_atoms, utf8_functions, extra_chunks,
   57:      cover, env, core_pp, core_roundtrip, asm, asm_labels, no_core_prepare,
   58:      sys_pre_attributes, dialyzer, warnings, pre_load_check,
   59:      env_compiler_options, custom_debug_info, bc_options,
   60:      custom_compile_info, deterministic_include, deterministic_paths,
   61:      compile_attribute, message_printing, other_options, transforms,
   62:      erl_compile_api, types_pp, bs_init_writable, annotations_pp].
   63: 
   64: groups() -> 
   65:     [].
   66: 
   67: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   68:     test_lib:recompile(?MODULE),
   69:     Config.
   70: 
   71: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   72:     ok.
   73: 
   74: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   75: 	Config.
   76: 
   77: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   78: 	Config.
   79: 
   80: 
   81: 
   82: %% Test that the Application file has no `basic' errors.";
   83: app_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   84:     test_server:app_test(compiler).
   85: 
   86: %% Test that the Application upgrade file has no `basic' errors.";
   87: appup_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   88:     ok = test_server:appup_test(compiler).
   89: 
   90: %% Check that a file compiled to the abstract form and dumped with -E
   91: %% can be compiled. We use a file constructed to produce errors if the
   92: %% dumping fails to legalize compiler generated variable names.
   93: bigE_roundtrip(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   94:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
   95:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
   96:     Source = filename:join(DataDir, "bigE.erl"),
   97:     TargetDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "bigE"),
   98:     Target = filename:join(TargetDir, "bigE.E"),
   99:     TargetSource = filename:join(TargetDir, "bigE.erl"),
  100:     ok = file:make_dir(TargetDir),
  101:     io:format("Source: ~p~nTargetDir: ~p~nTarget: ~p\n",
  102:               [Source, TargetDir, Target]),
  103:     case compile:file(Source,
  104:                       ['E', warnings_as_errors, {outdir, TargetDir}]) of
  105:         {ok, _} -> ok;
  106:         Other -> ct:fail({unexpected_result, Other})
  107:     end,
  108:     %% Rename the output to .erl so that the compiler accepts it and
  109:     %% we won't get a warning due to the filename not matching the
  110:     %% module name.
  111:     ok = file:rename(Target, TargetSource),
  112:     case compile:file(TargetSource,
  113:                       [warnings_as_errors, {outdir, TargetDir}]) of
  114:         {ok, _} -> ok;
  115:         Other1 -> ct:fail({unexpected_result, Other1})
  116:     end,
  117:     file:delete(TargetSource),
  118:     file:del_dir(TargetDir),
  119:     ok.
  120: 
  121: %% Tests that we can compile and run a simple Erlang program,
  122: %% using compile:file/1.
  123: 
  124: file_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  125:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  126: 
  127:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  128:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  129: 
  130:     {Simple, Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "file_1"),
  131:     {ok, Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
  132:     ok = file:set_cwd(filename:dirname(Target)),
  133: 
  134:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [slim]), %Smoke test only.
  135:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple),	%Smoke test only.
  136: 
  137:     compile_and_verify(Simple, Target, []),
  138:     compile_and_verify(Simple, Target, [debug_info]),
  139:     compile_and_verify(Simple, Target, [no_postopt]),
  140: 
  141:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [no_line_info]), %Coverage
  142:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [{eprof,beam_z}]), %Coverage
  143: 
  144:     %% Cover option not in a list (undocumented feature).
  145:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, no_postopt),
  146: 
  147:     %% Test compiling from an .abstr file.
  148:     {ok,[]} = compile:file(Simple, [dabstr]),
  149:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(filename:rootname(Target), [from_abstr]),
  150:     ok = file:delete(filename:rootname(Target) ++ ".abstr"),
  151: 
  152:     %% Test option 'deterministic'.
  153:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [deterministic]),
  154:     {module,simple} = c:l(simple),
  155:     [{version,_}] = simple:module_info(compile),
  156:     true = code:delete(simple),
  157:     false = code:purge(simple),
  158: 
  159:     ok = file:set_cwd(Cwd),
  160:     true = exists(Target),
  161:     passed = run(Target, test, []),
  162: 
  163:     %% Test option 'deterministic' as a compiler attribute.
  164:     Det = deterministic_module,
  165:     {DetPath, DetTarget} = get_files(Config, Det, "det_target"),
  166:     {ok,Det,DetCode} = compile:file(DetPath, [binary]),
  167:     {module,Det} = code:load_binary(Det, "", DetCode),
  168:     [{version,_}] = Det:module_info(compile),
  169:     true = code:delete(Det),
  170:     false = code:purge(Det),
  171: 
  172:     %% Cover error handling code.
  173:     NonExisting = definitely__no__such__module,
  174:     error = compile:file(NonExisting, [report]),
  175:     error = compile:file(NonExisting, [from_abstr,report]),
  176:     error = compile:file(NonExisting, [from_core,report]),
  177:     error = compile:file(NonExisting, [from_asm,report]),
  178: 
  179:     error = compile:file(filename:join(DataDir, "bad_core"), [from_core,report]),
  180:     error = compile:file(filename:join(DataDir, "bad_core_tokens"), [from_core,report]),
  181: 
  182:     %% Cover handling of obsolete options.
  183:     ObsoleteOptions = [r18,r19,r20,r21,no_bsm3,no_get_hd_tl,no_put_tuple2,no_utf8_atoms],
  184:     _ = [begin
  185:              {error,[{_Simple,
  186:                       [{none,compile,{obsolete_option,Opt}}]}],
  187:               []} =
  188:                  compile:file(Simple, [Opt,return]),
  189:              error = compile:file(Simple, [Opt,report])
  190:          end || Opt <- ObsoleteOptions],
  191: 
  192:     %% Create a directory with the same name as the temp file to cover
  193:     %% handling of write errors.
  194:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, "simple"),
  195:     SimpleTempFile = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple.bea#"),
  196:     SimpleOutputFile = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple.beam"),
  197:     ok = file:make_dir(SimpleTempFile),
  198:     ok = file:make_dir(SimpleOutputFile),
  199:     try
  200:         error = compile:file(Simple, [{outdir,PrivDir}, report]),
  201:         _ = file:del_dir(SimpleTempFile),
  202:         error = compile:file(Simple, [{outdir,PrivDir}, report])
  203:     after
  204:         _ = file:del_dir(SimpleTempFile),
  205:         _ = file:del_dir(SimpleOutputFile)
  206:     end,
  207: 
  208:     %% Cleanup.
  209:     ok = file:delete(Target),
  210:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target)),
  211:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(DetTarget)),
  212: 
  213:     %% There should not be any messages in the messages.
  214:     receive
  215: 	Any ->
  216: 	    ct:fail({unexpected,Any})
  217:     after 10 ->
  218: 	    ok
  219:     end,
  220: 
  221:     ok.
  222: 
  223: forms_2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  224:     {Simple, Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "file_1"),
  225:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target)),
  226: 
  227:     Src = Simple,
  228:     AbsSrc = filename:absname(Src),
  229:     {ok,[],SimpleCode} = compile:file(Simple, [dabstr,binary]),
  230: 
  231:     {ok,simple,Bin1} = compile:forms(SimpleCode, [binary,{source,Src}]),
  232:     {ok,simple,_} = compile:forms(SimpleCode,
  233:                                   [binary,{error_location,line},{source,Src}]),
  234: 
  235:     %% Cover option not in a list (undocumented feature).
  236:     {ok,simple,_} = compile:forms(SimpleCode, no_postopt),
  237: 
  238:     %% Load and test that the proper source is returned.
  239:     AbsSrc = forms_load_code(simple, Src, Bin1),
  240: 
  241:     %% Work in a deleted directory.
  242:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  243:     WorkDir = filename:join(PrivDir, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
  244:     ok = file:make_dir(WorkDir),
  245:     ok = file:set_cwd(WorkDir),
  246:     case os:type() of
  247: 	{unix,_} -> os:cmd("rm -rf " ++ WorkDir);
  248: 	_ -> ok
  249:     end,
  250:     {ok,simple,Bin2} = compile:forms(SimpleCode),
  251:     undefined = forms_load_code(simple, "ignore", Bin2),
  252: 
  253:     {ok,simple,Bin3} = compile:forms(SimpleCode, [{source,Src},report]),
  254:     case forms_load_code(simple, "ignore", Bin3) of
  255: 	Src ->					%Unix.
  256: 	    ok;
  257: 	AbsSrc ->				%Windows.
  258: 	    ok
  259:     end,
  260: 
  261:     {ok,simple,Core} = compile:forms(SimpleCode, [to_core0,binary]),
  262:     forms_compile_and_load(Core, [from_core]),
  263: 
  264:     {ok,simple,Asm} = compile:forms(SimpleCode, [to_asm,binary]),
  265:     forms_compile_and_load(Asm, [from_asm]),
  266: 
  267:     %% The `from_abstr` option is redundant when compiling from forms,
  268:     %% but it should work.
  269:     forms_compile_and_load(SimpleCode, [from_abstr]),
  270: 
  271:     %% Cover the error handling code.
  272:     error = compile:forms(bad_core, [from_core,report]),
  273:     error = compile:forms(bad_asm, [from_asm,report]),
  274: 
  275:     ok.
  276: 
  277: 
  278: forms_load_code(Mod, Src, Bin) ->
  279:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, Src, Bin),
  280:     Info = Mod:module_info(compile),
  281:     SourceOption = proplists:get_value(source, Info),
  282: 
  283:     %% Ensure that the options are not polluted with 'source'.
  284:     [] = proplists:get_value(options, Info),
  285: 
  286:     %% Cleanup.
  287:     true = code:delete(simple),
  288:     false = code:purge(simple),
  289: 
  290:     SourceOption.
  291: 
  292: forms_compile_and_load(Code, Opts) ->
  293:     Mod = simple,
  294:     {ok,Mod,Bin} = compile:forms(Code, Opts),
  295:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "ignore", Bin),
  296:     _ = Mod:module_info(),
  297:     true = code:delete(simple),
  298:     false = code:purge(simple),
  299:     ok.
  300: 
  301: module_mismatch(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  302:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  303:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "wrong_module_name.erl"),
  304:     {error,[{"wrong_module_name.beam",
  305: 	     [{none,compile,{module_name,arne,"wrong_module_name"}}]}],
  306: 	   []} = compile:file(File, [return]),
  307:     error = compile:file(File, [report]),
  308: 
  309:     {ok,arne,[]} = compile:file(File,
  310: 				      [return,no_error_module_mismatch]),
  311: 
  312:     ok.
  313: 
  314: %% Tests that the {outdir, Dir} option works.
  315: 
  316: outdir(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  317:     {Simple, Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "outdir"),
  318:     {ok, simple} = compile:file(Simple, [{outdir, filename:dirname(Target)}]),
  319:     true = exists(Target),
  320:     passed = run(Target, test, []),
  321:     ok = file:delete(Target),
  322:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target)),
  323:     ok.
  324: 
  325: %% Tests that the binary option works.
  326: 
  327: binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  328:     {Simple, Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "binary"),
  329:     {ok, simple, Binary} = compile:file(Simple, [binary]),
  330:     code:load_binary(simple, Target, Binary),
  331:     passed = simple:test(),
  332:     true = code:delete(simple),
  333:     false = code:purge(simple),
  334:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target)),
  335:     ok.
  336: 
  337: %% Tests that the dependencies-Makefile-related options work.
  338: 
  339: makedep(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  340:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  341:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  342: 
  343:     {Simple,Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "makedep"),
  344:     SimpleRootname = filename:rootname(Simple),
  345:     IncludeDir = filename:join(filename:dirname(Simple), "include"),
  346:     IncludeOptions = [
  347: 		      {d,need_foo},
  348: 		      {d,foo_value,42},
  349: 		      {d,include_generated},
  350: 		      {i,IncludeDir}
  351: 		     ],
  352: 
  353:     %% Basic rule.
  354:     BasicMf1Name = SimpleRootname ++ "-basic1.mk",
  355:     {ok,BasicMf1} = file:read_file(BasicMf1Name),
  356:     {ok,_,Mf1} = compile:file(Simple, [binary,makedep]),
  357:     BasicMf1 = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf1, DataDir),
  358: 
  359:     %% Basic rule with one existing header.
  360:     BasicMf2Name = SimpleRootname ++ "-basic2.mk",
  361:     {ok,BasicMf2} = file:read_file(BasicMf2Name),
  362:     {ok,_,Mf2} = compile:file(Simple, [binary,makedep|IncludeOptions]),
  363:     BasicMf2 = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf2, DataDir),
  364: 
  365:     %% Rule with one existing header and one missing header.
  366:     MissingMfName = SimpleRootname ++ "-missing.mk",
  367:     {ok,MissingMf} = file:read_file(MissingMfName),
  368:     {ok,_,Mf3} = compile:file(Simple,
  369:       [binary,makedep,makedep_add_missing|IncludeOptions]),
  370:     MissingMf = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf3, DataDir),
  371: 
  372:     %% Rule with modified target.
  373:     TargetMf1Name = SimpleRootname ++ "-target1.mk",
  374:     {ok,TargetMf1} = file:read_file(TargetMf1Name),
  375:     {ok,_,Mf4} = compile:file(Simple,
  376:       [binary,makedep,{makedep_target,"$target"}|IncludeOptions]),
  377:     TargetMf1 = makedep_modify_target(
  378:       makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf4, DataDir), "$$target"),
  379: 
  380:     %% Rule with quoted modified target.
  381:     TargetMf2Name = SimpleRootname ++ "-target2.mk",
  382:     {ok,TargetMf2} = file:read_file(TargetMf2Name),
  383:     {ok,_,Mf5} = compile:file(Simple,
  384:       [binary,makedep,{makedep_target,"$target"},makedep_quote_target|
  385:         IncludeOptions]),
  386:     TargetMf2 = makedep_modify_target(
  387:       makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf5, DataDir), "$$target"),
  388: 
  389:     %% Basic rule written to some file.
  390:     {ok,_} = compile:file(Simple,
  391:       [makedep,{makedep_output,Target}|IncludeOptions]),
  392:     {ok,Mf6} = file:read_file(Target),
  393:     BasicMf2 = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf6, DataDir),
  394: 
  395:     %% Rule with creating phony target.
  396:     PhonyMfName = SimpleRootname ++ "-phony.mk",
  397:     {ok,PhonyMf} = file:read_file(PhonyMfName),
  398:     {ok,_,Mf7} = compile:file(Simple,
  399:       [binary,makedep,makedep_phony|IncludeOptions]),
  400:     PhonyMf = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf7, DataDir),
  401: 
  402:     %% Basic rule written to the default file.
  403:     {ok,_} = compile:file(Simple, [makedep|IncludeOptions]),
  404:     {ok,Mf8} = file:read_file(Target),
  405:     BasicMf2 = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf8, DataDir),
  406: 
  407:     %% Generate dependencies and compile normally at the same time.
  408:     GeneratedHrl = filename:join(PrivDir, "generated.hrl"),
  409:     ok = file:write_file(GeneratedHrl, ""),
  410:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [report,makedep_side_effect,
  411:                                         {makedep_output,Target},
  412:                                         {i,PrivDir}|IncludeOptions]),
  413:     {ok,Mf9} = file:read_file(Target),
  414:     BasicMf3 = iolist_to_binary([string:trim(BasicMf2), " ", filename:join(PrivDir, "generated.hrl"), "\n"]),
  415:     BasicMf3 = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf9, DataDir),
  416:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report,makedep_side_effect,
  417:                                   {makedep_output,PrivDir}|IncludeOptions]),
  418: 
  419:     %% Cover generation of long lines that must be split.
  420:     CompileModule = filename:join(code:lib_dir(compiler), "src/compile.erl"),
  421:     {ok,_} = compile:file(CompileModule, [report,
  422:                                           makedep,{makedep_output,standard_io},
  423:                                           {i,filename:join(code:lib_dir(stdlib), "include")}]),
  424: 
  425:     %% Basic rule written to the standard output.
  426:     {ok,_} = compile:file(Simple, [makedep,{makedep_output,standard_io}|IncludeOptions]),
  427: 
  428:     %% Test error handling.
  429:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report,makedep,{makedep_output,DataDir}]),
  430:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report,makedep,{makedep_output,a_bad_output_device}]),
  431: 
  432:     ok = file:delete(Target),
  433:     ok = file:delete(GeneratedHrl),
  434:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target)),
  435:     ok.
  436: 
  437: makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf, DataDir) ->
  438:     Mf0 = binary_to_list(Mf),
  439:     %% Replace the Datadir by "$(srcdir)".
  440:     Mf1 = re:replace(Mf0, DataDir, "$(srcdir)/",
  441:       [global,multiline,{return,list}]),
  442:     %% Long lines are split, put back everything on one line.
  443:     Mf2 = re:replace(Mf1, "\\\\\n  ", "", [global,multiline,{return,list}]),
  444:     list_to_binary(Mf2).
  445: 
  446: makedep_modify_target(Mf, Target) ->
  447:     Mf0 = binary_to_list(Mf),
  448:     Mf1 = re:replace(Mf0, Target, "$target", [{return,list}]),
  449:     list_to_binary(Mf1).
  450: 
  451: %% Tests that conditional compilation, defining values, including files work.
  452: 
  453: no_core_prepare(_Config) ->
  454:     Mod = {c_module,[],
  455:               {c_literal,[],sample_receive},
  456:               [{c_var,[],{discard,0}}],
  457:               [],
  458:               [{{c_var,[],{discard,0}},
  459:                 {c_fun,[],[],
  460:                     {c_case,[],
  461:                         {c_values,[],[]},
  462:                         [{c_clause,[],[],
  463:                              {c_literal,[],true},
  464:                              {c_receive,[],[],{c_literal,[],0},{c_literal,[],ok}}}]}}}]},
  465: 
  466:     {ok,sample_receive,_,_} = compile:forms(Mod, [from_core,binary,return]),
  467:     {error,_,_} = compile:forms(Mod, [from_core,binary,return,no_core_prepare]),
  468:     ok.
  469: 
  470: cond_and_ifdef(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  471:     {Simple, Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "cond_and_ifdef"),
  472:     IncludeDir = filename:join(filename:dirname(Simple), "include"),
  473:     Options = [{outdir, filename:dirname(Target)},
  474: 		     {d, need_foo}, {d, foo_value, 42},
  475: 		     {i, IncludeDir}, report],
  476:     {ok, simple} = compile:file(Simple, Options),
  477:     true = exists(Target),
  478:     {hiker, 42} = run(Target, foo, []),
  479:     ok = file:delete(Target),
  480:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target)),
  481:     ok.
  482: 
  483: listings(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  484:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  485:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  486:     ok = do_file_listings(DataDir, PrivDir, [
  487: 	    "simple",
  488: 	    "small",
  489: 	    "small_maps"
  490: 	]),
  491: 
  492:     %% Cover handling of write errors.
  493:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, "simple"),
  494:     SimpleTarget = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple.S"),
  495:     ok = file:make_dir(SimpleTarget),
  496:     try
  497:         error = compile:file(Simple, ['S', {outdir,PrivDir}, report])
  498:     after
  499:         ok = file:del_dir(SimpleTarget)
  500:     end,
  501: 
  502:     ok.
  503: 
  504: do_file_listings(_, _, []) -> ok;
  505: do_file_listings(DataDir, PrivDir, [File|Files]) ->
  506:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, File),
  507:     TargetDir = filename:join(PrivDir, listings),
  508:     ok = file:make_dir(TargetDir),
  509: 
  510:     List = [{'S',".S"},
  511:             {'E',".E"},
  512:             {'P',".P"},
  513:             {dpp, ".pp"},
  514:             {dabstr, ".abstr"},
  515:             {dexp, ".expand"},
  516:             {dcore, ".core"},
  517:             {doldinline, ".oldinline"},
  518:             {dinline, ".inline"},
  519:             {dcore, ".core"},
  520:             {dcopt, ".copt"},
  521:             {dcbsm, ".core_bsm"},
  522:             {dkern, ".kernel"},
  523:             {dssa, ".ssa"},
  524:             {dbool, ".bool"},
  525:             {dssashare, ".ssashare"},
  526:             {dssaopt, ".ssaopt"},
  527:             {dprecg, ".precodegen"},
  528:             {dcg, ".codegen"},
  529:             {dblk, ".block"},
  530:             {djmp, ".jump"},
  531:             {dclean, ".clean"},
  532:             {dopt, ".optimize"},
  533:             {diffable, ".S"}],
  534:     p_listings(List, Simple, TargetDir),
  535: 
  536:     %% Test options that produce a listing file if 'binary' is not given.
  537:     do_listing(Simple, TargetDir, to_pp, ".P"),
  538:     do_listing(Simple, TargetDir, to_exp, ".E"),
  539:     do_listing(Simple, TargetDir, to_core0, ".core"),
  540:     ok = file:delete(filename:join(TargetDir, File ++ ".core")),
  541:     do_listing(Simple, TargetDir, to_core, ".core"),
  542:     do_listing(Simple, TargetDir, to_kernel, ".kernel"),
  543:     do_listing(Simple, TargetDir, to_dis, ".dis"),
  544: 
  545:     %% Final clean up.
  546:     lists:foreach(fun(F) -> ok = file:delete(F) end,
  547: 	filelib:wildcard(filename:join(TargetDir, "*"))),
  548:     ok = file:del_dir(TargetDir),
  549: 
  550:     do_file_listings(DataDir,PrivDir,Files).
  551: 
  552: listings_big(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  553:     {Big,Target} = get_files(Config, big, listings_big),
  554:     TargetDir = filename:dirname(Target),
  555:     List = [{'S',".S"},
  556:             {'E',".E"},
  557:             {'P',".P"},
  558:             {dkern, ".kernel"},
  559:             {dssa, ".ssa"},
  560:             {dssaopt, ".ssaopt"},
  561:             {dprecg, ".precodegen"},
  562:             {to_dis, ".dis"}],
  563:     p_listings(List, Big, TargetDir).
  564: 
  565: p_listings(List, File, BaseDir) ->
  566:     Run = fun({Option,Extension}) ->
  567:                   Uniq = erlang:unique_integer([positive]),
  568:                   Dir = filename:join(BaseDir, integer_to_list(Uniq)),
  569:                   ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  570:                   try
  571:                       do_listing(File, Dir, Option, Extension),
  572:                       ok
  573:                   catch
  574:                       Class:Error:Stk ->
  575:                           io:format("~p:~p\n~p\n", [Class,Error,Stk]),
  576:                           error
  577:                   after
  578:                       _ = [ok = file:delete(F) ||
  579:                               F <- filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Dir, "*"))],
  580:                       ok = file:del_dir(Dir)
  581:                   end
  582:           end,
  583:     test_lib:p_run(Run, List).
  584: 
  585: other_output(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  586:     {Simple,_Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "other_output"),
  587: 
  588:     io:put_chars("to_pp"),
  589:     {ok,[],PP} = compile:file(Simple, [to_pp,binary,time]),
  590:     [] = [E || E <- PP,
  591: 	       begin
  592: 		   case element(1, E) of
  593: 		       attribute -> false;
  594: 		       function -> false;
  595: 		       eof -> false
  596: 		   end
  597: 	       end],
  598: 
  599:     io:put_chars("to_exp (file)"),
  600:     {ok,[],Expand} = compile:file(Simple, [to_exp,binary,time]),
  601:     true = is_list(Expand),
  602:     {attribute,_,module,simple} = lists:keyfind(module, 3, Expand),
  603:     io:put_chars("to_exp (forms)"),
  604:     {ok,[],Expand} = compile:forms(PP, [to_exp,binary,time]),
  605: 
  606:     io:put_chars("to_core (file)"),
  607:     {ok,simple,Core} = compile:file(Simple, [to_core,binary,time]),
  608:     c_module = element(1, Core),
  609:     {ok,_} = core_lint:module(Core),
  610:     io:put_chars("to_core (forms)"),
  611:     {ok,simple,Core} = compile:forms(PP, [to_core,binary,time]),
  612: 
  613:     io:put_chars("to_kernel (file)"),
  614:     {ok,simple,Kernel} = compile:file(Simple, [to_kernel,binary,time]),
  615:     k_mdef = element(1, Kernel),
  616:     io:put_chars("to_kernel (forms)"),
  617:     {ok,simple,Kernel} = compile:forms(PP, [to_kernel,binary,time]),
  618: 
  619:     io:put_chars("to_asm (file)"),
  620:     {ok,simple,Asm} = compile:file(Simple, [to_asm,binary,time]),
  621:     {simple,_,_,_,_} = Asm,
  622:     io:put_chars("to_asm (forms)"),
  623:     {ok,simple,Asm} = compile:forms(PP, [to_asm,binary,time]),
  624: 
  625:     ok.
  626: 
  627: %% Smoke test and cover of pretty-printing of Kernel code.
  628: kernel_listing(_Config) ->
  629:     TestBeams = get_unique_beam_files(),
  630:     Abstr = [begin {ok,{Mod,[{abstract_code,
  631: 			      {raw_abstract_v1,Abstr}}]}} =
  632: 		       beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
  633: 		   {Mod,Abstr} end || Beam <- TestBeams],
  634:     test_lib:p_run(fun(F) -> do_kernel_listing(F) end, Abstr).
  635: 
  636: do_kernel_listing({M,A}) ->
  637:     try
  638: 	{ok,M,Kern} = compile:forms(A, [to_kernel]),
  639: 	IoList = v3_kernel_pp:format(Kern),
  640: 	case unicode:characters_to_binary(IoList) of
  641: 	    Bin when is_binary(Bin) ->
  642: 		ok
  643: 	end
  644:     catch
  645: 	throw:{error,Error} ->
  646: 	    io:format("*** compilation failure '~p' for module ~s\n",
  647: 		      [Error,M]),
  648: 	    error;
  649: 	Class:Error:Stk ->
  650: 	    io:format("~p: ~p ~p\n~p\n", [M,Class,Error,Stk]),
  651: 	    error
  652:     end.
  653: 
  654: encrypted_abstr(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  655:     {Simple,Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "encrypted_abstr"),
  656: 
  657:     Res = case has_crypto() of
  658: 	      false ->
  659: 		  %% No crypto.
  660: 		  encrypted_abstr_no_crypto(Simple, Target),
  661: 		  {comment,"The crypto application is missing or broken"};
  662: 	      true ->
  663: 		  %% Simulate not having crypto by removing
  664: 		  %% the crypto application from the path.
  665: 		  OldPath = code:get_path(),
  666: 		  try
  667: 		      NewPath = OldPath -- [filename:dirname(code:which(crypto))],
  668: 		      (catch crypto:stop()),
  669: 		      code:delete(crypto),
  670: 		      code:purge(crypto),
  671: 		      code:set_path(NewPath),
  672: 		      encrypted_abstr_no_crypto(Simple, Target)
  673: 		      after
  674: 			  code:set_path(OldPath)
  675: 		      end,
  676: 
  677: 		  %% Now run the tests that require crypto.
  678: 		  encrypted_abstr_1(Simple, Target),
  679: 		  ok = file:delete(Target),
  680: 		  _ = file:del_dir_r(filename:dirname(Target))
  681: 	  end,
  682:     
  683:     %% Cleanup.
  684:     Res.
  685: 
  686: encrypted_abstr_1(Simple, Target) ->
  687:     TargetDir = filename:dirname(Target),
  688:     Key = "ablurf123BX#$;3",
  689:     install_crypto_key(Key),
  690:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple,
  691: 				     [debug_info,{debug_info_key,Key},
  692: 				      {outdir,TargetDir}]),
  693:     verify_abstract(Target, erl_abstract_code),
  694: 
  695:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple,
  696: 				     [{debug_info_key,Key},
  697: 				      {outdir,TargetDir}]),
  698:     verify_abstract(Target, erl_abstract_code),
  699: 
  700:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple,
  701: 				     [debug_info,{debug_info_key,{des3_cbc,Key}},
  702: 				      {outdir,TargetDir}]),
  703:     verify_abstract(Target, erl_abstract_code),
  704: 
  705:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple,
  706: 				     [{debug_info,{?MODULE,ok}},
  707: 				      {debug_info_key,Key},
  708: 				      {outdir,TargetDir}]),
  709:     verify_abstract(Target, ?MODULE),
  710: 
  711:     {ok,{simple,[{compile_info,CInfo}]}} =
  712: 	beam_lib:chunks(Target, [compile_info]),
  713:     {_,Opts} = lists:keyfind(options, 1, CInfo),
  714:     {_,'********'} = lists:keyfind(debug_info_key, 1, Opts),
  715: 
  716:     %% Try some illegal forms of crypto keys.
  717:     error = compile:file(Simple,
  718: 			       [debug_info,{debug_info_key,{blurf,"ss"}},report]),
  719:     error = compile:file(Simple,
  720: 			       [debug_info,{debug_info_key,{blurf,1,"ss"}},report]),
  721:     error = compile:file(Simple,
  722: 			       [debug_info,{debug_info_key,42},report]),
  723: 
  724:     beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  725: 
  726:     %% Test to place the crypto file on disk. The test is dependent on the
  727:     %% $HOME of the emulator, so we do this test in another node.
  728:     TestHome = filename:join(TargetDir, "home"),
  729:     filelib:ensure_dir(TestHome),
  730:     HomeEnv = case os:type() of
  731:                   {win32, _} ->
  732:                       [Drive | Path] = filename:split(TestHome),
  733:                       [{"APPDATA", filename:join(TestHome,"AppData")},
  734:                        {"HOMEDRIVE", Drive}, {"HOMEPATH", filename:join(Path)}];
  735:                   _ ->
  736:                       [{"HOME", TestHome}]
  737:               end,
  738: 
  739:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{ env => HomeEnv }),
  740: 
  741:     erpc:call(
  742:       Node,
  743:       fun() ->
  744:               {ok,OldCwd} = file:get_cwd(),
  745:               ok = file:set_cwd(TargetDir),
  746: 
  747:               error = compile:file(Simple, [encrypt_debug_info,report]),
  748: 
  749:               CWDKey = "better use another key here",
  750:               CWDFile = ".erlang.crypt",
  751:               XDGKey = "better use yet another key here",
  752:               XDGFile = filename:join(
  753:                           filename:basedir(user_config,"erlang"),
  754:                           ".erlang.crypt"),
  755:               HOMEKey = "better use the home key here",
  756:               HOMEFile = filename:join(TestHome,".erlang.crypt"),
  757: 
  758:               write_crypt_file(CWDFile, CWDKey),
  759:               write_crypt_file(XDGFile, XDGKey),
  760:               write_crypt_file(HOMEFile, HOMEKey),
  761: 
  762:               %% First we test that .erlang.crypt in cwd works
  763:               {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [encrypt_debug_info,report]),
  764:               verify_abstract("simple.beam", erl_abstract_code),
  765:               ok = file:delete(CWDFile),
  766:               beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  767: 
  768:               %% Then we test that .erlang.crypt in HOME does **not** work
  769:               {error,beam_lib,{key_missing_or_invalid,"simple.beam",abstract_code}} =
  770:                   beam_lib:chunks("simple.beam", [abstract_code]),
  771: 
  772:               %% Then we test that .erlang.crypt in HOME does work
  773:               {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [encrypt_debug_info,report]),
  774:               verify_abstract("simple.beam", erl_abstract_code),
  775:               ok = file:delete(HOMEFile),
  776:               beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  777: 
  778:               %% Then we test that .erlang.crypt in XDG does **not** work
  779:               {error,beam_lib,{key_missing_or_invalid,"simple.beam",abstract_code}} =
  780:                   beam_lib:chunks("simple.beam", [abstract_code]),
  781: 
  782: 
  783:               %% Then we test that .erlang.crypt in XDG does work
  784:               {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [encrypt_debug_info,report]),
  785:               verify_abstract("simple.beam", erl_abstract_code),
  786:               ok = file:delete(XDGFile),
  787: 
  788:               beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  789:               {error,beam_lib,{key_missing_or_invalid,"simple.beam",abstract_code}} =
  790:                   beam_lib:chunks("simple.beam", [abstract_code])
  791: 
  792:       end),
  793: 
  794:     peer:stop(Peer),
  795: 
  796:     %% Test key compatibility by reading a BEAM file produced before
  797:     %% the update to the new crypto functions.
  798:     install_crypto_key("an old key"),
  799:     KeyCompat = filename:join(filename:dirname(Simple),
  800: 			      "key_compatibility"),
  801:     {ok,{key_compatibility,[Chunk]}} = beam_lib:chunks(KeyCompat,
  802: 						       [abstract_code]),
  803:     {abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,_}} = Chunk,
  804: 
  805:     ok.
  806: 
  807: write_crypt_file(File, Key) ->
  808:     Contents = ["[{debug_info,des3_cbc,simple,\"",Key,"\"}].\n"],
  809:     io:format("~s: ~s\n", [File, Contents]),
  810:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(File),
  811:     ok = file:write_file(File, Contents).
  812: 
  813: encrypted_abstr_no_crypto(Simple, Target) ->
  814:     io:format("simpe: ~p~n", [Simple]),
  815:     TargetDir = filename:dirname(Target),
  816:     Key = "ablurf123BX#$;3",
  817:     error = compile:file(Simple,
  818: 			       [debug_info,{debug_info_key,Key},
  819: 				{outdir,TargetDir},report]),
  820:     ok.
  821:     
  822: verify_abstract(Beam, Backend) ->
  823:     {ok,{simple,[Abst, Dbgi]}} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code, debug_info]),
  824:     {abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,_}} = Abst,
  825:     {debug_info,{debug_info_v1,Backend,_}} = Dbgi.
  826: 
  827: has_crypto() ->
  828:     try
  829: 	crypto:start(),
  830: 	crypto:stop(),
  831: 	true
  832:     catch
  833: 	error:_ -> false
  834:     end.
  835: 
  836: install_crypto_key(Key) ->
  837:     F = fun (init) -> ok;
  838: 	    ({debug_info,des3_cbc,_,_}) -> Key;
  839: 	    (clear) -> ok
  840: 	end,
  841:     ok = beam_lib:crypto_key_fun(F).
  842: 
  843: %% Miscellaneous tests, mainly to get better coverage.
  844: debug_info(erlang_v1, Module, ok, _Opts) ->
  845:     {ok, [Module]};
  846: debug_info(erlang_v1, _Module, error, _Opts) ->
  847:     {error, unknown_format}.
  848: 
  849: custom_debug_info(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  850:     {Simple,_} = get_files(Config, simple, "file_1"),
  851: 
  852:     {ok,simple,OkBin} = compile:file(Simple, [binary, {debug_info,{?MODULE,ok}}]), %Coverage
  853:     {ok,{simple,[{abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,[simple]}}]}} =
  854: 	beam_lib:chunks(OkBin, [abstract_code]),
  855:     {ok,{simple,[{debug_info,{debug_info_v1,?MODULE,ok}}]}} =
  856: 	beam_lib:chunks(OkBin, [debug_info]),
  857: 
  858:     {ok,simple,ErrorBin} = compile:file(Simple, [binary, {debug_info,{?MODULE,error}}]), %Coverage
  859:     {ok,{simple,[{abstract_code,no_abstract_code}]}} =
  860: 	beam_lib:chunks(ErrorBin, [abstract_code]),
  861:     {ok,{simple,[{debug_info,{debug_info_v1,?MODULE,error}}]}} =
  862: 	beam_lib:chunks(ErrorBin, [debug_info]).
  863: 
  864: custom_compile_info(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  865:     Anno = erl_anno:new(1),
  866:     Forms = [{attribute,Anno,module,custom_compile_info}],
  867:     Opts = [binary,{compile_info,[{another,version}]}],
  868: 
  869:     {ok,custom_compile_info,Bin} = compile:forms(Forms, Opts),
  870:     {ok,{custom_compile_info,[{compile_info,CompileInfo}]}} =
  871: 	beam_lib:chunks(Bin, [compile_info]),
  872:     version = proplists:get_value(another, CompileInfo),
  873:     CompileOpts = proplists:get_value(options, CompileInfo),
  874:     undefined = proplists:get_value(compile_info, CompileOpts),
  875: 
  876:     {ok,custom_compile_info,DetBin} = compile:forms(Forms, [deterministic|Opts]),
  877:     {ok,{custom_compile_info,[{compile_info,DetInfo}]}} =
  878: 	beam_lib:chunks(DetBin, [compile_info]),
  879:     version = proplists:get_value(another, DetInfo).
  880: 
  881: cover(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  882:     io:format("~p\n", [compile:options()]),
  883:     ok.
  884: 
  885: do_listing(Source, TargetDir, Type, Ext) ->
  886:     io:format("Source: ~p TargetDir: ~p\n  Type: ~p Ext: ~p\n",
  887: 	      [Source, TargetDir, Type, Ext]),
  888:     case compile:file(Source, [Type, time, {outdir, TargetDir}]) of
  889: 	{ok, _} -> ok;
  890: 	Other -> ct:fail({unexpected_result, Other})
  891:     end,
  892:     SourceBase = filename:rootname(filename:basename(Source)),
  893: 
  894:     Target = filename:join(TargetDir, SourceBase ++ Ext),
  895:     true = exists(Target).
  896: 
  897: get_files(Config, Module, OutputName) ->
  898:     code:delete(Module),
  899:     code:purge(Module),
  900:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  901:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  902:     Src = filename:join(DataDir, atom_to_list(Module)),
  903:     TargetDir = filename:join(PrivDir, OutputName),
  904:     ok = file:make_dir(TargetDir),
  905:     File = atom_to_list(Module) ++ code:objfile_extension(),
  906:     Target = filename:join(TargetDir, File),
  907:     {Src, Target}.
  908: 
  909: run(Target, Func, Args) ->
  910:     Module = list_to_atom(filename:rootname(filename:basename(Target))),
  911:     {module, Module} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(Target)),
  912:     Result = (catch apply(Module, Func, Args)),
  913:     true = code:delete(Module),
  914:     false = code:purge(Module),
  915:     Result.
  916: 
  917: exists(Name) ->
  918:     case file:read_file_info(Name) of
  919: 	{ok, _}    -> true;
  920: 	{error, _} -> false
  921:     end.
  922: 
  923: 
  924: strict_record(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  925:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  926:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config)),
  927:     Opts = [{outdir,Priv},report_errors],
  928:     M = record_access,
  929:  
  930:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, [strict_record_tests|Opts]),
  931:     Turtle = test_strict(),
  932: 
  933:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, [no_strict_record_tests|Opts]),
  934:     Turtle = test_sloppy(),
  935: 
  936:     %% The option first given wins.
  937:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, [no_strict_record_tests,strict_record_tests|Opts]),
  938:     Turtle = test_sloppy(),
  939:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, [strict_record_tests,no_strict_record_tests|Opts]),
  940:     Turtle = test_strict(),
  941: 
  942:     %% Default (possibly influenced by ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS).
  943:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, [{outdir,Priv},report_errors]),
  944:     try
  945:         {1,2} = record_access:test(Turtle),
  946:         {comment,"Default: no_strict_record_tests"}
  947:     catch
  948:         error:{badrecord,Turtle} ->
  949:             {comment,"Default: strict_record_tests"}
  950:     end.
  951: 
  952: test_strict() ->
  953:     Turtle = record_access:turtle(),
  954:     try
  955:         record_access:test(Turtle)
  956:     catch
  957:         error:{badrecord,Turtle} ->
  958:             ok
  959:     end,
  960:     Turtle.
  961: 
  962: test_sloppy() ->
  963:     Turtle = record_access:turtle(),
  964:     {1,2} = record_access:test(Turtle),
  965:     Turtle.
  966: 
  967: utf8_atoms(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  968:     Anno = erl_anno:new(1),
  969:     Atom = binary_to_atom(<<""/utf8>>, utf8),
  970:     Forms = [{attribute,Anno,compile,[export_all]},
  971: 	     {function,Anno,atom,0,[{clause,Anno,[],[],[{atom,Anno,Atom}]}]}],
  972: 
  973:     Utf8AtomForms = [{attribute,Anno,module,utf8_atom}|Forms],
  974:     {ok,utf8_atom,Utf8AtomBin} =
  975: 	compile:forms(Utf8AtomForms, [binary]),
  976:     {ok,{utf8_atom,[{atoms,_}]}} =
  977: 	beam_lib:chunks(Utf8AtomBin, [atoms]),
  978:     code:load_binary(utf8_atom, "compile_SUITE", Utf8AtomBin),
  979:     Atom = utf8_atom:atom(),
  980:     true = is_atom(Atom),
  981:     ok.
  982: 
  983: utf8_functions(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  984:     Anno = erl_anno:new(1),
  985:     Atom = binary_to_atom(<<""/utf8>>, utf8),
  986:     Forms = [{attribute,Anno,compile,[export_all]},
  987: 	     {function,Anno,Atom,0,[{clause,Anno,[],[],[{atom,Anno,world}]}]}],
  988: 
  989:     Utf8FunctionForms = [{attribute,Anno,module,utf8_function}|Forms],
  990:     {ok,utf8_function,Utf8FunctionBin} =
  991: 	compile:forms(Utf8FunctionForms, [binary]),
  992:     {ok,{utf8_function,[{atoms,_}]}} =
  993: 	beam_lib:chunks(Utf8FunctionBin, [atoms]),
  994:     code:load_binary(utf8_function, "compile_SUITE", Utf8FunctionBin),
  995:     world = utf8_function:Atom(),
  996: 
  997:     NoUtf8FunctionForms = [{attribute,Anno,module,no_utf8_function}|Forms],
  998:     error = compile:forms(NoUtf8FunctionForms, [binary, r19]).
  999: 
 1000: extra_chunks(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1001:     Anno = erl_anno:new(1),
 1002:     Forms = [{attribute,Anno,module,extra_chunks}],
 1003: 
 1004:     {ok,extra_chunks,ExtraChunksBinary} =
 1005: 	compile:forms(Forms, [binary, {extra_chunks, [{<<"ExCh">>, <<"Contents">>}]}]),
 1006:     {ok,{extra_chunks,[{"ExCh",<<"Contents">>}]}} =
 1007: 	beam_lib:chunks(ExtraChunksBinary, ["ExCh"]).
 1008: 
 1009: tuple_calls(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1010:     Anno = erl_anno:new(1),
 1011:     Forms = [{attribute,Anno,export,[{size,1},{store,1}]},
 1012: 	     {function,Anno,size,1,
 1013: 	      [{clause,Anno,[{var,Anno,mod}],[],
 1014: 	       [{call,Anno,{remote,Anno,{var,Anno,mod},{atom,Anno,size}},
 1015:                  []}]}]},
 1016: 	     {function,Anno,store,1,
 1017: 	      [{clause,Anno,[{var,Anno,mod}],[],
 1018: 	       [{call,Anno,{remote,Anno,{var,Anno,mod},{atom,Anno,store}},
 1019:                  [{atom,Anno,key},{atom,Anno,value}]}]}]}],
 1020: 
 1021:     TupleCallsFalse = [{attribute,Anno,module,tuple_calls_false}|Forms],
 1022:     {ok,_,TupleCallsFalseBinary} = compile:forms(TupleCallsFalse, [binary]),
 1023:     code:load_binary(tuple_calls_false, "compile_SUITE.erl", TupleCallsFalseBinary),
 1024:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch tuple_calls_false:store(dict())),
 1025:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch tuple_calls_false:size(dict())),
 1026:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch tuple_calls_false:size(empty_tuple())),
 1027: 
 1028:     TupleCallsTrue = [{attribute,Anno,module,tuple_calls_true}|Forms],
 1029:     {ok,_,TupleCallsTrueBinary} = compile:forms(TupleCallsTrue, [binary,tuple_calls]),
 1030:     code:load_binary(tuple_calls_true, "compile_SUITE.erl", TupleCallsTrueBinary),
 1031:     Dict = tuple_calls_true:store(dict()),
 1032:     1 = tuple_calls_true:size(Dict),
 1033:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch tuple_calls_true:size(empty_tuple())),
 1034: 
 1035:     ok.
 1036: 
 1037: dict() ->
 1038:     dict:new().
 1039: empty_tuple() ->
 1040:     {}.
 1041: 
 1042: env(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1043:     {Simple,Target} = get_files(Config, simple, env),
 1044:     {ok,Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
 1045:     ok = file:set_cwd(filename:dirname(Target)),
 1046: 
 1047:     true = os:putenv("ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "binary"),
 1048:     try
 1049: 	env_1(Simple, Target)
 1050:     after
 1051: 	true = os:putenv("ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "ignore_me"),
 1052: 	file:set_cwd(Cwd),
 1053: 	file:delete(Target),
 1054: 	file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target))
 1055:     end,
 1056:     ok.
 1057: 
 1058: env_1(Simple, Target) ->
 1059:     %% file
 1060:     {ok,simple,<<_/binary>>} = compile:file(Simple),
 1061:     {ok,simple} = compile:noenv_file(Simple, [debug_info]),
 1062:     {ok,simple} = compile:noenv_file(Simple, debug_info),
 1063: 
 1064:     true = exists(Target),
 1065:     {ok,{simple,[{abstract_code,Abstr0}]}} =
 1066: 	beam_lib:chunks(Target, [abstract_code]),
 1067:     {raw_abstract_v1,Forms} = Abstr0,
 1068: 
 1069:     %% forms
 1070:     true = os:putenv("ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "strong_validation"),
 1071:     {ok,simple} = compile:forms(Forms),
 1072:     {ok,simple,<<"FOR1",_/binary>>} = compile:noenv_forms(Forms, []),
 1073: 
 1074:     %% output_generated
 1075:     false = compile:output_generated([]),
 1076:     true = compile:noenv_output_generated([]),
 1077: 
 1078:     ok = file:delete(Target),
 1079: 
 1080:     %% Cover error handling.
 1081:     true = os:putenv("ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "'unterminated_atom"),
 1082:     {ok,[]} = compile:forms(Forms, [basic_validation]),
 1083:     true = os:putenv("ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", ",,,"),
 1084:     {ok,[]} = compile:forms(Forms, [basic_validation]),
 1085:     {ok,simple,<<"FOR1",_/binary>>} = compile:noenv_forms(Forms, no_postopt),
 1086: 
 1087:     ok.
 1088: 
 1089: %% Test pretty-printing in Core Erlang format and then try to
 1090: %% compile the generated Core Erlang files.
 1091: 
 1092: core_pp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1093:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1094:     Outdir = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME)),
 1095:     ok = file:make_dir(Outdir),
 1096: 
 1097:     TestBeams = get_unique_beam_files(),
 1098:     Abstr = [begin {ok,{Mod,[{abstract_code,
 1099: 				    {raw_abstract_v1,Abstr}}]}} = 
 1100: 			     beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
 1101: 			 {Mod,Abstr} end || Beam <- TestBeams],
 1102:     test_lib:p_run(fun(F) -> do_core_pp(F, Outdir) end, Abstr).
 1103:     
 1104: do_core_pp({M,A}, Outdir) ->
 1105:     try
 1106: 	do_core_pp_1(M, A, Outdir)
 1107:     catch
 1108: 	throw:{error,Error} ->
 1109: 	    io:format("*** compilation failure '~p' for module ~s\n",
 1110: 		      [Error,M]),
 1111: 	    error;
 1112: 	Class:Error:Stk ->
 1113: 	    io:format("~p: ~p ~p\n~p\n", [M,Class,Error,Stk]),
 1114: 	    error
 1115:     end.
 1116: 
 1117: do_core_pp_1(M, A, Outdir) ->
 1118:     {ok,M,Core0} = compile:forms(A, [to_core]),
 1119:     CoreFile = filename:join(Outdir, atom_to_list(M)++".core"),
 1120:     CorePP = core_pp:format(Core0),
 1121:     ok = file:write_file(CoreFile, unicode:characters_to_binary(CorePP)),
 1122: 
 1123:     %% Parse the .core file and return the result as Core Erlang Terms.
 1124:     Core = case compile:file(CoreFile, [report_errors,from_core,no_copt,to_core,binary]) of
 1125: 	       {ok,M,Core1} -> Core1;
 1126: 	       Other -> throw({error,Other})
 1127: 	   end,
 1128:     ok = file:delete(CoreFile),
 1129: 
 1130:     %% Compile as usual (including optimizations).
 1131:     compile_forms(M, Core, [clint,ssalint,from_core,binary]),
 1132: 
 1133:     %% Don't optimize to test that we are not dependent
 1134:     %% on the Core Erlang optimization passes.
 1135:     %% (Example of a previous bug: The core_parse pass
 1136:     %% would not turn map literals into #c_literal{}
 1137:     %% records; if sys_core_fold was run it would fix
 1138:     %% that; if sys_core_fold was not run v3_kernel would
 1139:     %% crash.)
 1140:     compile_forms(M, Core, [clint,ssalint,from_core,no_copt,binary]),
 1141: 
 1142:     ok.
 1143: 
 1144: compile_forms(Mod, Forms, Opts) ->
 1145:     case compile:forms(Forms, [report_errors|Opts]) of
 1146: 	{ok,Mod,_} ->  ok;
 1147: 	Other -> throw({error,Other})
 1148:     end.
 1149: 
 1150: %% Pretty-print core and read it back. Should be identical.
 1151: 
 1152: core_roundtrip(Config) ->
 1153:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1154:     Outdir = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME)),
 1155:     ok = file:make_dir(Outdir),
 1156: 
 1157:     TestBeams = get_unique_beam_files(),
 1158: 
 1159:     Test = fun(F) -> do_core_roundtrip(F, Outdir) end,
 1160:     case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
 1161:         4 ->
 1162:             %% This test case is very memory intensive. Only
 1163:             %% use a single process.
 1164:             test_lib:p_run(Test, TestBeams, 1);
 1165:         8 ->
 1166:             test_lib:p_run(Test, TestBeams)
 1167:     end.
 1168: 
 1169: do_core_roundtrip(Beam, Outdir) ->
 1170:     try
 1171: 	{ok,{Mod,[{abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,Abstr}}]}} =
 1172: 	    beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
 1173: 	do_core_roundtrip_1(Mod, Abstr, Outdir)
 1174:     catch
 1175: 	throw:{error,Error} ->
 1176: 	    io:format("*** compilation failure '~p' for file ~s\n",
 1177: 		      [Error,Beam]),
 1178: 	    error;
 1179: 	Class:Error:Stk ->
 1180: 	    io:format("~p: ~p ~p\n~p\n", [Beam,Class,Error,Stk]),
 1181: 	    error
 1182:     end.
 1183: 
 1184: do_core_roundtrip_1(Mod, Abstr, Outdir) ->
 1185:     {ok,Mod,Core0} = compile:forms(Abstr, [to_core0]),
 1186:     do_core_roundtrip_2(Mod, Core0, Outdir),
 1187: 
 1188:     %% Primarily, test that annotations are accepted for all
 1189:     %% constructs. Secondarily, smoke test cerl_trees:label/1.
 1190:     {Core1,_} = cerl_trees:label(Core0),
 1191:     do_core_roundtrip_2(Mod, Core1, Outdir),
 1192: 
 1193:     %% Run the inliner to force generation of variables
 1194:     %% with numeric names.
 1195:     {ok,Mod,Core2} = compile:forms(Abstr, [inline,to_core]),
 1196:     do_core_roundtrip_2(Mod, Core2, Outdir).
 1197: 
 1198: do_core_roundtrip_2(M, Core0, Outdir) ->
 1199:     CoreFile = filename:join(Outdir, atom_to_list(M)++".core"),
 1200:     CorePP = core_pp:format_all(Core0),
 1201:     ok = file:write_file(CoreFile, unicode:characters_to_binary(CorePP)),
 1202: 
 1203:     %% Parse the .core file and return the result as Core Erlang Terms.
 1204:     Core2 = case compile:file(CoreFile, [report_errors,from_core,
 1205: 					 no_copt,to_core,binary]) of
 1206: 		{ok,M,Core1} -> Core1;
 1207: 		Other -> throw({error,Other})
 1208: 	    end,
 1209:     Core = undo_var_translation(Core2),
 1210:     ok = file:delete(CoreFile),
 1211: 
 1212:     case cmp_core(Core0, Core, M) of
 1213: 	true -> ok;
 1214: 	false -> error
 1215:     end.
 1216: 
 1217: undo_var_translation(Tree) ->
 1218:     F = fun(Node) ->
 1219: 		case cerl:is_c_var(Node) of
 1220: 		    true ->
 1221: 			Name0 = cerl:var_name(Node),
 1222: 			try atom_to_list(Name0) of
 1223: 			    "_X"++Name ->
 1224: 				cerl:update_c_var(Node, list_to_atom(Name));
 1225: 			    "_"++Name ->
 1226: 				cerl:update_c_var(Node, list_to_atom(Name));
 1227: 			    _ ->
 1228: 				Node
 1229: 			catch
 1230: 			    error:badarg ->
 1231: 				Node
 1232: 
 1233: 			end;
 1234: 		    false ->
 1235: 			Node
 1236: 		end
 1237: 	end,
 1238:     cerl_trees:map(F, Tree).
 1239: 
 1240: cmp_core(E, E, _Mod) ->
 1241:     true;
 1242: cmp_core(M1, M2, Mod) ->
 1243:     cmp_core_fs(cerl:module_defs(M1), cerl:module_defs(M2), Mod).
 1244: 
 1245: cmp_core_fs([F1|T1], [F2|T2], Mod) ->
 1246:     cmp_core_f(F1, F2, Mod) andalso cmp_core_fs(T1, T2, Mod);
 1247: cmp_core_fs([], [], _Mod) ->
 1248:     true;
 1249: cmp_core_fs(_, _, _Mod) ->
 1250:     false.
 1251: 
 1252: cmp_core_f(E, E, _Mod) ->
 1253:     true;
 1254: cmp_core_f({Name,F1}, {Name,F2}, Mod) ->
 1255:     case diff(F1, F2) of
 1256: 	F1 ->
 1257: 	    true;
 1258: 	Diff ->
 1259: 	    io:format("~p ~p:\n~p\n", [Mod,Name,Diff]),
 1260: 	    false
 1261:     end.
 1262: 
 1263: diff(E, E) ->
 1264:     E;
 1265: diff([H1|T1], [H2|T2]) ->
 1266:     [diff(H1, H2)|diff(T1, T2)];
 1267: diff(T1, T2) when tuple_size(T1) =:= tuple_size(T2) ->
 1268:     case cerl:is_c_var(T1) andalso cerl:is_c_var(T2) of
 1269:         true ->
 1270:             diff_var(T1, T2);
 1271:         false ->
 1272:             case cerl:is_c_map(T1) andalso cerl:is_c_map(T2) of
 1273:                 true ->
 1274:                     diff_map(T1, T2);
 1275:                 false ->
 1276:                     diff_tuple(T1, T2)
 1277:             end
 1278:     end;
 1279: diff(E1, E2) ->
 1280:     {'DIFF',E1,E2}.
 1281: 
 1282: diff_var(V1, V2) ->
 1283:     case {cerl:var_name(V1),cerl:var_name(V2)} of
 1284:         {Same,Same} ->
 1285:             V1;
 1286:         {Name1,Name2} ->
 1287:             %% The inliner uses integers as variable names. Such integers
 1288:             %% are read back as atoms.
 1289:             case is_integer(Name1) andalso
 1290:                 list_to_atom(integer_to_list(Name1)) =:= Name2 of
 1291:                 true ->
 1292:                     V1;
 1293:                 _ ->
 1294:                     cerl:update_c_var(V1, {'DIFF',Name1,Name2})
 1295:             end
 1296:     end.
 1297: 
 1298: %% Annotations for maps are not preserved exactly, but that is not
 1299: %% a real problem. Workaround by not comparing all annotations when
 1300: %% comparing maps.
 1301: 
 1302: diff_map(M, M) ->
 1303:     M;
 1304: diff_map(M1, M2) ->
 1305:     case cerl:get_ann(M1) =:= cerl:get_ann(M2) of
 1306:         false ->
 1307:             diff_tuple(M1, M2);
 1308:         true ->
 1309:             case remove_compiler_gen(M1) =:= remove_compiler_gen(M2) of
 1310:                 true ->
 1311:                     M1;
 1312:                 false ->
 1313:                     diff_tuple(M1, M2)
 1314:             end
 1315:     end.
 1316: 
 1317: diff_tuple(T1, T2) ->
 1318:     L = diff(tuple_to_list(T1), tuple_to_list(T2)),
 1319:     list_to_tuple(L).
 1320: 
 1321: remove_compiler_gen(M) ->
 1322:     Arg0 = cerl:map_arg(M),
 1323:     Arg = cerl:set_ann(Arg0, []),
 1324:     Es0 = cerl:map_es(M),
 1325:     Es = [remove_compiler_gen_1(Pair) || Pair <- Es0],
 1326:     cerl:update_c_map(M, Arg, Es).
 1327: 
 1328: remove_compiler_gen_1(Pair) ->
 1329:     Op0 = cerl:map_pair_op(Pair),
 1330:     Op = cerl:set_ann(Op0, []),
 1331:     K = map_var(cerl:map_pair_key(Pair)),
 1332:     V = map_var(cerl:map_pair_val(Pair)),
 1333:     cerl:update_c_map_pair(Pair, Op, K, V).
 1334: 
 1335: map_var(Var) ->
 1336:     case cerl:is_c_var(Var) of
 1337:         true ->
 1338:             case cerl:var_name(Var) of
 1339:                 Name when is_atom(Name) ->
 1340:                     L = atom_to_list(Name),
 1341:                     try list_to_integer(L) of
 1342:                         Int ->
 1343:                             cerl:update_c_var(Var, Int)
 1344:                     catch
 1345:                         error:_ ->
 1346:                             Var
 1347:                     end;
 1348:                 _ ->
 1349:                     Var
 1350:             end;
 1351:         false ->
 1352:             Var
 1353:     end.
 1354: 
 1355: %% Compile to Beam assembly language (.S) and then try to
 1356: %% run .S through the compiler again.
 1357: 
 1358: asm(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1359:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1360:     Outdir = filename:join(PrivDir, "asm"),
 1361:     ok = file:make_dir(Outdir),
 1362: 
 1363:     TestBeams = get_unique_beam_files(),
 1364:     Res = test_lib:p_run(fun(F) -> do_asm(F, Outdir) end, TestBeams),
 1365:     Res.
 1366: 
 1367:     
 1368: do_asm(Beam, Outdir) ->
 1369:     {ok,{M,[{abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,A}}]}} =
 1370: 	beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
 1371:     try
 1372:         Opts = test_lib:opt_opts(M),
 1373: 	{ok,M,Asm} = compile:forms(A, ['S'|Opts]),
 1374: 	AsmFile = filename:join(Outdir, atom_to_list(M)++".S"),
 1375: 	{ok,Fd} = file:open(AsmFile, [write,{encoding,utf8}]),
 1376: 	beam_listing:module(Fd, Asm),
 1377: 	ok = file:close(Fd),
 1378:         case compile:file(AsmFile, [from_asm,binary,report|Opts]) of
 1379: 	    {ok,M,_} ->
 1380: 		ok = file:delete(AsmFile);
 1381: 	    Other ->
 1382: 		io:format("*** failure '~p' for ~s\n",
 1383: 			  [Other,AsmFile]),
 1384: 		error
 1385: 	end
 1386:     catch Class:Error:Stk ->
 1387: 	    io:format("~p: ~p ~p\n~p\n", [M,Class,Error,Stk]),
 1388: 	    error
 1389:     end.
 1390: 
 1391: %% Compile a crafted file which produces the three call instructions
 1392: %% which should have a comment with the called function in clear
 1393: %% text. We check that the expected functions and comments occur in
 1394: %% the listing.
 1395: 
 1396: asm_labels(Config) ->
 1397:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1398:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1399:     InFile = filename:join(DataDir, "asm_labels.erl"),
 1400:     OutDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "asm_labels"),
 1401:     OutFile = filename:join(OutDir, "asm_labels.S"),
 1402:     ok = file:make_dir(OutDir),
 1403:     {ok,asm_labels} = compile:file(InFile, ['S',{outdir,OutDir}]),
 1404:     {ok,Listing} = file:read_file(OutFile),
 1405:     Os = [global,multiline,{capture,all_but_first,list}],
 1406:     {match,[_]} = re:run(Listing, "({call,.+,{f,.+}}\\. % foo/1)", Os),
 1407:     {match,[_]} = re:run(Listing, "({call_only,.+,{f,.+}}\\. % foo/1)", Os),
 1408:     {match,[_]} = re:run(Listing, "({call_last,.+,{f,.+},.+}\\. % bar/1)", Os),
 1409:     ok = file:del_dir_r(OutDir).
 1410: 
 1411: sys_pre_attributes(Config) ->
 1412:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1413:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "attributes.erl"),
 1414:     Mod = attributes,
 1415:     CommonOpts = [binary,report,verbose,
 1416: 		  {parse_transform,sys_pre_attributes}],
 1417:     PreOpts = [{attribute,delete,deleted}],
 1418:     PostOpts = [{attribute,insert,inserted,"value"}],
 1419:     PrePostOpts = [{attribute,replace,replaced,42},
 1420: 		   {attribute,replace,replace_nonexisting,new}],
 1421:     {ok,Mod,Code} = compile:file(File, PrePostOpts ++ PreOpts ++
 1422: 				     PostOpts ++ CommonOpts),
 1423:     code:load_binary(Mod, File, Code),
 1424:     Attr = Mod:module_info(attributes),
 1425:     io:format("~p", [Attr]),
 1426:     {inserted,"value"} = lists:keyfind(inserted, 1, Attr),
 1427:     {replaced,[42]} = lists:keyfind(replaced, 1, Attr),
 1428:     {replace_nonexisting,[new]} = lists:keyfind(replace_nonexisting, 1, Attr),
 1429:     false = lists:keymember(deleted, 1, Attr),
 1430: 
 1431:     %% Cover more code.
 1432:     {ok,Mod,_} = compile:file(File, PostOpts ++ CommonOpts),
 1433:     {ok,Mod,_} = compile:file(File, CommonOpts -- [verbose]),
 1434:     {ok,Mod,_} = compile:file(File, PreOpts ++ CommonOpts),
 1435:     {ok,Mod,_} = compile:file(File,
 1436: 			      [{attribute,replace,replaced,42}|CommonOpts]),
 1437:     {ok,Mod,_} = compile:file(File, PrePostOpts ++ PreOpts ++
 1438: 				  PostOpts ++ CommonOpts --
 1439: 				  [report,verbose]),
 1440:     ok.
 1441: 
 1442: %% Test the dialyzer option to cover more code.
 1443: dialyzer(Config) ->
 1444:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1445:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config)),
 1446:     Opts = [{outdir,Priv},report_errors],
 1447:     M = dialyzer_test,
 1448:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, [dialyzer|Opts]),
 1449:     [{a,b,c}] = M:M(),
 1450: 
 1451:     %% Cover huge line numbers without the 'dialyzer' option.
 1452:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, Opts),
 1453:     [{a,b,c}] = M:M(),
 1454:     ok.
 1455: 
 1456: 
 1457: %% Test that warnings contain filenames and line numbers.
 1458: warnings(_Config) ->
 1459:     Files = get_unique_files(".erl"),
 1460:     test_lib:p_run(fun do_warnings/1, Files).
 1461: 
 1462: do_warnings(F) ->
 1463:     Options = [{feature,maybe_expr,enable},binary,bin_opt_info,recv_opt_info,return],
 1464:     {ok,_,_,Ws} = compile:file(F, Options),
 1465:     do_warnings_1(Ws, F).
 1466: 
 1467: do_warnings_1([{"no_file",Ws}|_], F) ->
 1468:     io:format("~s:\nMissing file for warnings: ~p\n",
 1469: 	      [F,Ws]),
 1470:     error;
 1471: do_warnings_1([{Name,Ws}|T], F) ->
 1472:     case filename:extension(Name) of
 1473: 	".erl" ->
 1474: 	    do_warnings_2(Ws, T, F);
 1475: 	_ ->
 1476: 	    io:format("~s:\nNo .erl extension\n", [F]),
 1477: 	    error
 1478:     end;
 1479: do_warnings_1([], _) -> ok.
 1480: 
 1481: do_warnings_2([{Pos,_,_}=W|T], Next, F) ->
 1482:     case Pos of
 1483: 	Line when is_integer(Line) ->
 1484: 	    do_warnings_2(T, Next, F);
 1485: 	{Line,Col} when is_integer(Line), is_integer(Col) ->
 1486: 	    do_warnings_2(T, Next, F);
 1487: 	true ->
 1488: 	    io:format("~s:\nMissing line number: ~p\n",
 1489: 		      [F,W]),
 1490: 	    error
 1491:     end;
 1492: do_warnings_2([], Next, F) ->
 1493:     do_warnings_1(Next, F).
 1494: 
 1495: message_printing(Config) ->
 1496:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1497:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1498: 
 1499:     BadEncFile = filename:join(DataDir, "bad_enc.erl"),
 1500:     {error,BadEncErrors, []} = compile:file(BadEncFile, [return]),
 1501: 
 1502:     [":7:15: cannot parse file, giving up\n"
 1503:      "%    7| \t    {ok, \"xyz\n"
 1504:      "%     | \t             ^\n\n"
 1505:     ,
 1506:      ":7:15: cannot translate from UTF-8\n"
 1507:      "%    7| \t    {ok, \"xyz\n"
 1508:      "%     | \t             ^\n\n"
 1509:     ] = messages(BadEncErrors),
 1510: 
 1511:     UTF8File = filename:join(DataDir, "col_utf8.erl"),
 1512:     {ok,_,UTF8Errors} = compile:file(UTF8File, [return]),
 1513:     [":5:23: a term is constructed, but never used\n"
 1514:      "%    5|     B = <<\"xyz\">>,\t<<\"12345\">>,\n"
 1515:      "%     |                      \t^\n\n"
 1516:     ] = messages(UTF8Errors),
 1517: 
 1518:     Latin1File = filename:join(DataDir, "col_lat1.erl"),
 1519:     {ok,_,Latin1Errors} = compile:file(Latin1File, [return]),
 1520:     [":6:23: a term is constructed, but never used\n"
 1521:      "%    6|     B = <<\"xyz\">>,\t<<\"12345\">>,\n"
 1522:      "%     |                      \t^\n\n"
 1523:     ] = messages(Latin1Errors),
 1524: 
 1525:     LongFile = filename:join(PrivDir, "long.erl"),
 1526:     Long = ["-module(long).\n",
 1527:             "-export([foo/0]).\n",
 1528:             "unused() -> ok.\n",
 1529:             lists:duplicate(10000, $\n),
 1530:             "foo() -> bar().\n"],
 1531:     ok = file:write_file(LongFile, Long),
 1532:     {error,LongErrors,LongWarnings} = compile:file(LongFile, [return]),
 1533:     [":10004:10: function bar/0 undefined\n"
 1534:      "% 10004| foo() -> bar().\n"
 1535:      "%      |          ^\n\n"
 1536:     ] = messages(LongErrors),
 1537:     [":3:1: function unused/0 is unused\n"
 1538:      "%    3| unused() -> ok.\n"
 1539:      "%     | ^\n\n"
 1540:     ] = messages(LongWarnings),
 1541:     ok = file:delete(LongFile),
 1542: 
 1543:     {ok,OldCwd} = file:get_cwd(),
 1544:     try
 1545:         ok = file:set_cwd(DataDir),
 1546:         {ok,cover_messages,_} = compile:file(cover_messages, [report, binary])
 1547:     after
 1548:         file:set_cwd(OldCwd)
 1549:     end,
 1550: 
 1551:     ok.
 1552: 
 1553: messages(Errors) ->
 1554:     lists:flatmap(fun ({{File,_L},Descs}) -> format_descs(File, Descs);
 1555:                       ({File,Descs}) -> format_descs(File, Descs)
 1556:                   end,
 1557:                   Errors).
 1558: 
 1559: format_descs(File, Descs) ->
 1560:     [strip_prefix(File, lists:flatten(Text))
 1561:      || {_Where, Text} <- sys_messages:format_messages(File, "", Descs, [])].
 1562: 
 1563: strip_prefix(Prefix, String) ->
 1564:     case string:prefix(String, Prefix) of
 1565:         nomatch -> String;
 1566:         Rest -> Rest
 1567:     end.
 1568: 
 1569: %% Test that the compile:pre_load/0 function (used by 'erlc')
 1570: %% pre-loads the modules that are used by a typical compilation.
 1571: 
 1572: pre_load_check(Config) ->
 1573:     case test_server:is_cover() of
 1574:         true ->
 1575:             {skip,"Cover is running"};
 1576:         false ->
 1577:             try
 1578:                 do_pre_load_check(Config)
 1579:             after
 1580:                 dbg:stop()
 1581:             end
 1582:     end.
 1583: 
 1584: do_pre_load_check(Config) ->
 1585:     DataDir = ?config(data_dir, Config),
 1586:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, "simple.erl"),
 1587:     Big = filename:join(DataDir, "big.erl"),
 1588:     {ok,_} = dbg:tracer(process, {fun pre_load_trace/2,[]}),
 1589:     dbg:p(self(), call),
 1590:     dbg:p(new, call),
 1591:     {ok,_} = dbg:tpl({?MODULE,get_trace_data,0}, []),
 1592:     {ok,_} = dbg:tp({code,ensure_modules_loaded,1}, []),
 1593: 
 1594:     %% Compile a simple module using the erl_compile interface
 1595:     %% to find out the modules that are pre-loaded by
 1596:     %% compile:pre_load/0.
 1597:     Opts = #options{specific=[binary]},
 1598:     {ok,simple,_} = compile:compile(Simple, "", Opts),
 1599:     [{code,ensure_modules_loaded,[PreLoaded0]}] = get_trace_data(),
 1600:     PreLoaded1 = ordsets:from_list(PreLoaded0),
 1601: 
 1602:     %% Since 'compile' is the function doing the pre-loaded,
 1603:     %% it is useless to include it in the list.
 1604:     case ordsets:is_element(compile, PreLoaded1) of
 1605: 	true ->
 1606: 	    io:put_chars("The 'compile' module should not be included "
 1607: 			 "in the list of modules to be pre-loaded."),
 1608: 	    ct:fail(compile);
 1609: 	false ->
 1610: 	    []
 1611:     end,
 1612:     PreLoaded = ordsets:add_element(compile, PreLoaded1),
 1613: 
 1614:     %% Now unload all pre-loaded modules and all modules in
 1615:     %% compiler application. Then compile a module to find
 1616:     %% which modules that get loaded.
 1617:     CompilerMods = compiler_modules(),
 1618:     Unload = ordsets:union(ordsets:from_list(CompilerMods), PreLoaded),
 1619:     _ = [begin
 1620: 	     code:delete(M),
 1621: 	     code:purge(M)
 1622: 	 end || M <- Unload],
 1623: 
 1624:     {ok,_} = dbg:ctp({code,ensure_modules_loaded,1}),
 1625:     {ok,_} = dbg:tp({code,ensure_loaded,1}, []),
 1626:     {ok,big,_} = compile:file(Big, [binary]),
 1627:     WasLoaded0 = get_trace_data(),
 1628:     WasLoaded1 = [M || {code,ensure_loaded,[M]} <- WasLoaded0],
 1629:     WasLoaded = ordsets:from_list(WasLoaded1),
 1630: 
 1631:     %% Check for modules that should have been pre-loaded.
 1632:     case ordsets:subtract(WasLoaded, PreLoaded) of
 1633: 	[] ->
 1634: 	    ok;
 1635: 	[_|_]=NotPreLoaded ->
 1636: 	    io:format("The following modules were used "
 1637: 		      "but not pre-loaded:\n~p\n",
 1638: 		      [NotPreLoaded]),
 1639: 	    ct:fail({not_preload,NotPreLoaded})
 1640:     end,
 1641: 
 1642:     %% Check for modules that should not be pre-loaded.
 1643:     case ordsets:subtract(PreLoaded, WasLoaded) of
 1644: 	[] ->
 1645: 	    ok;
 1646: 	[_|_]=NotUsed ->
 1647: 	    io:format("The following modules were pre-loaded"
 1648: 		      " but not used:\n~p\n",
 1649: 		      [NotUsed]),
 1650: 	    ct:fail({not_used,NotUsed})
 1651:     end,
 1652: 
 1653:     ok.
 1654: 
 1655: get_trace_data() ->
 1656:     %% Apparantely, doing a receive at the beginning of
 1657:     %% a traced function can cause extra trace messages.
 1658:     %% To avoid that, don't do the receive in this function.
 1659:     do_get_trace_data().
 1660: 
 1661: do_get_trace_data() ->
 1662:     receive
 1663: 	{trace_data,Data} -> Data
 1664:     end.
 1665: 
 1666: pre_load_trace({trace,Pid,call,{?MODULE,get_trace_data,[]}}, Acc) ->
 1667:     Pid ! {trace_data,Acc},
 1668:     [];
 1669: pre_load_trace({trace,_,call,MFA}, Acc) ->
 1670:     [MFA|Acc].
 1671: 
 1672: compiler_modules() ->
 1673:     Wc = filename:join([code:lib_dir(compiler),"ebin","*.beam"]),
 1674:     Ms = filelib:wildcard(Wc),
 1675:     FN = filename,
 1676:     [list_to_atom(FN:rootname(FN:basename(M), ".beam")) || M <- Ms].
 1677: 
 1678: %% Test that ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS are correctly retrieved
 1679: %% by env_compiler_options/0
 1680: 
 1681: env_compiler_options(_Config) ->
 1682:     Cases = [
 1683:         {"bin_opt_info", [bin_opt_info]},
 1684:         {"recv_opt_info", [recv_opt_info]},
 1685:         {"'S'", ['S']},
 1686:         {"{source, \"test.erl\"}", [{source, "test.erl"}]},
 1687:         {"[{d,macro_one,1},{d,macro_two}]", [{d, macro_one, 1}, {d, macro_two}]},
 1688:         {"[warn_export_all, warn_export_vars]", [warn_export_all, warn_export_vars]}
 1689:     ],
 1690:     F = fun({Env, Expected}) ->
 1691:         true = os:putenv("ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", Env),
 1692:         Expected = compile:env_compiler_options()
 1693:     end,
 1694:     lists:foreach(F, Cases).
 1695: 
 1696: %% Test options for compatibility with previous major versions of OTP.
 1697: 
 1698: bc_options(Config) ->
 1699:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1700: 
 1701:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1702: 
 1703:     L = [{101, small_float, [no_shared_fun_wrappers,no_line_info]},
 1704:          {125, small_float, [no_shared_fun_wrappers,
 1705:                              no_line_info,
 1706:                              no_ssa_opt_float,
 1707:                              no_type_opt]},
 1708: 
 1709:          {153, small_float, [no_shared_fun_wrappers]},
 1710: 
 1711:          {164, small_maps, [no_init_yregs,no_shared_fun_wrappers,no_type_opt]},
 1712:          {164, small_maps, [r22]},
 1713:          {164, big, [r22]},
 1714:          {164, funs, [r22]},
 1715:          {164, funs, [no_init_yregs,no_shared_fun_wrappers,
 1716:                       no_ssa_opt_record,
 1717:                       no_line_info,no_stack_trimming,
 1718:                       no_make_fun3,no_type_opt]},
 1719: 
 1720:          {168, small, [r22]},
 1721:          {168, small, [no_init_yregs,no_shared_fun_wrappers,
 1722:                        no_ssa_opt_record,no_make_fun3,
 1723:                        no_ssa_opt_float,no_line_info,no_type_opt,
 1724:                        no_bs_match]},
 1725:          {169, small, [r23]},
 1726: 
 1727:          {169, big, [no_init_yregs,no_shared_fun_wrappers,
 1728:                      no_ssa_opt_record,
 1729:                      no_line_info,no_stack_trimming,
 1730:                      no_make_fun3,no_type_opt]},
 1731:          {169, big, [r23]},
 1732: 
 1733:          {169, small_maps, [no_init_yregs,no_type_opt]},
 1734: 
 1735:          {171, big, [no_init_yregs,no_shared_fun_wrappers,
 1736:                      no_ssa_opt_record,
 1737:                      no_ssa_opt_float,no_line_info,
 1738:                      no_type_opt]},
 1739:          {171, funs, [no_init_yregs,no_shared_fun_wrappers,
 1740:                       no_ssa_opt_record,
 1741:                       no_ssa_opt_float,no_line_info,
 1742:                       no_type_opt]},
 1743: 
 1744:          {178, funs, []},
 1745:          {178, big, []}
 1746:         ],
 1747: 
 1748:     Test = fun({Expected,Mod,Options}) ->
 1749:                    case highest_opcode(DataDir, Mod, Options) of
 1750:                        Expected ->
 1751:                            ok;
 1752:                        Got ->
 1753:                            io:format("*** module ~p, options ~p => got ~p; expected ~p\n",
 1754:                                      [Mod,Options,Got,Expected]),
 1755:                            error
 1756:                    end
 1757:            end,
 1758:     test_lib:p_run(Test, L),
 1759:     ok.
 1760: 
 1761: highest_opcode(DataDir, Mod, Opt) ->
 1762:     Src = filename:join(DataDir, atom_to_list(Mod)++".erl"),
 1763:     {ok,Mod,Beam} = compile:file(Src, [binary,report_errors|Opt]),
 1764:     test_lib:highest_opcode(Beam).
 1765: 
 1766: deterministic_include(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1767:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1768:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, "simple"),
 1769:  
 1770:     %% Files without +deterministic should differ if their include paths do,
 1771:     %% as their debug info will be different.
 1772:     {ok,_,NonDetA} = compile:file(Simple, [binary, {i,"gurka"}]),
 1773:     {ok,_,NonDetB} = compile:file(Simple, [binary, {i,"gaffel"}]),
 1774:     true = NonDetA =/= NonDetB,
 1775: 
 1776:     %% ... but files with +deterministic shouldn't.
 1777:     {ok,_,DetC} = compile:file(Simple, [binary, deterministic, {i,"gurka"}]),
 1778:     {ok,_,DetD} = compile:file(Simple, [binary, deterministic, {i,"gaffel"}]),
 1779:     true = DetC =:= DetD,
 1780: 
 1781:     ok.
 1782: 
 1783: deterministic_paths(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1784:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1785: 
 1786:     %% Files without +deterministic should differ if they were compiled from a
 1787:     %% different directory.
 1788:     true = deterministic_paths_1(DataDir, "simple", []),
 1789: 
 1790:     %% ... but files with +deterministic shouldn't.
 1791:     false = deterministic_paths_1(DataDir, "simple", [deterministic]),
 1792: 
 1793:     ok.
 1794: 
 1795: deterministic_paths_1(DataDir, Name, Opts) ->
 1796:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, "simple"),
 1797:     {ok, Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
 1798:     try
 1799:         {ok,_,A} = compile:file(Simple, [binary | Opts]),
 1800:         ok = file:set_cwd(DataDir),
 1801:         {ok,_,B} = compile:file(Name, [binary | Opts]),
 1802:         A =/= B
 1803:     after
 1804:         file:set_cwd(Cwd)
 1805:     end.
 1806: 
 1807: %% ERL-1058: -compile(debug_info) had no effect
 1808: compile_attribute(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1809:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1810: 
 1811:     %% The test module has a -compile([debug_info]). attribute, which means
 1812:     %% debug information should always be included.
 1813:     debug_info_attribute(DataDir, "debug_info", [debug_info]),
 1814:     debug_info_attribute(DataDir, "debug_info", []),
 1815: 
 1816:     ok.
 1817: 
 1818: debug_info_attribute(DataDir, Name, Opts) ->
 1819:     File = filename:join(DataDir, Name),
 1820:     {ok,_,Bin} = compile:file(File, [binary | Opts]),
 1821:     {ok, {_, Attrs}} = beam_lib:chunks(Bin, [debug_info]),
 1822: 
 1823:     [{debug_info,{debug_info_v1,erl_abstract_code, {Forms, _}}}] = Attrs,
 1824:     [{attribute,{1,1},file,{_,1}},
 1825:      {attribute,{1,2},module,debug_info},
 1826:      {attribute,{2,2},compile,[debug_info]},
 1827:      {eof,_}] = forms_to_terms(Forms),
 1828: 
 1829:     ok.
 1830: 
 1831: forms_to_terms(Forms) ->
 1832:     [erl_parse:anno_to_term(Form) || Form <- Forms].
 1833: 
 1834: %% Test compiler options not tested in other test cases.
 1835: other_options(Config) ->
 1836:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1837: 
 1838:     %% Smoke test of no_spawn_compiler_process, brief, and absolute_source
 1839:     %% options.
 1840:     Big = filename:join(DataDir, "big"),
 1841:     {ok,big,<<_/binary>>} =
 1842:         compile:file(Big, [binary,
 1843:                            no_spawn_compiler_process,
 1844:                            brief,
 1845:                            absolute_source,
 1846:                            report]),
 1847: 
 1848:     %% Test generating a compressed BEAM file. Also cover the redundant
 1849:     %% `beam` option and the `no_inline` option.
 1850:     Small = filename:join(DataDir, "small"),
 1851:     {ok,small} = compile:file(Small, [report, no_inline, compressed, beam]),
 1852: 
 1853:     ok.
 1854: 
 1855: %% Test core transforms and parse transforms.
 1856: transforms(Config) ->
 1857:     {ok, Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
 1858:     try
 1859:         do_transforms(Config)
 1860:     after
 1861:         file:set_cwd(Cwd)
 1862:     end.
 1863: 
 1864: do_transforms(Config) ->
 1865:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1866:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1867:     TargetDir = filename:join(PrivDir, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
 1868:     ok = file:make_dir(TargetDir),
 1869:     ok = file:set_cwd(TargetDir),
 1870: 
 1871:     %% Compile our parse transforms.
 1872:     LinePt = filename:join(DataDir, "line_pt"),
 1873:     {ok,line_pt} = compile:file(LinePt, [report, {outdir,TargetDir}]),
 1874:     ColumnPt = filename:join(DataDir, "column_pt"),
 1875:     {ok,column_pt} = compile:file(ColumnPt, [report, {outdir,TargetDir}]),
 1876:     GenericPt = filename:join(DataDir, "generic_pt"),
 1877:     {ok,generic_pt} = compile:file(GenericPt, [report, {outdir,TargetDir}]),
 1878: 
 1879:     %% Compile a file using line_pt and verify that column numbers
 1880:     %% have been stripped.
 1881:     Big = filename:join(DataDir, "big"),
 1882:     {[],[_|_]} = compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{parse_transform,line_pt}]),
 1883: 
 1884:     %% Compile a file using column_pt and verify that column numbers
 1885:     %% have NOT been stripped.
 1886:     {[_|_],[]} = compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{parse_transform,column_pt}]),
 1887: 
 1888:     %% Compile a file using column_pt and error_location=line and verify
 1889:     %% that column numbers have been stripped.
 1890:     {[],[_|_]} = compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{error_location,line},
 1891:                                                   {parse_transform,column_pt}]),
 1892: 
 1893:     %% Compile a file using column_pt, line_pt and verify
 1894:     %% that column numbers have been stripped.
 1895:     {[],[_|_]} = compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{parse_transform,column_pt},
 1896:                                                   {parse_transform,line_pt}]),
 1897: 
 1898:     %% Compile a file using column_pt that adds columns and error_location=line and
 1899:     %% verify that column numbers have been stripped.
 1900:     {[],[_|_]} = compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{error_location,line},
 1901:                                                   add_columns,
 1902:                                                   {parse_transform,column_pt}]),
 1903: 
 1904:     %% Compile a file using column_pt that adds columns and error_location=line and
 1905:     %% then call column_pt again to check that columns are stripped in between calls.
 1906:     %% and then verify that column numbers have been stripped from output.
 1907:     {[],[_|_]} = compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{error_location,line},
 1908:                                                   add_columns,
 1909:                                                   {parse_transform,column_pt},
 1910:                                                   {parse_transform,column_pt}]),
 1911: 
 1912:     %% Compile a file using column_pt that adds columns and en error and error_location=line and
 1913:     %% verify that column numbers have been stripped.
 1914:     {error,[{_What,[{Line,_,_}]}],[_|_]} =
 1915:         compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{error_location,line},
 1916:                                          add_columns,
 1917:                                          add_error,
 1918:                                          {parse_transform,column_pt}]),
 1919:     true = is_integer(Line),
 1920: 
 1921:     %% Cover transform code implementing the `time` option.
 1922:     {ok,big,_} = compile:file(Big, [binary, time, report,
